summary: This is an FBI FD-302 interview report summarizing an interview conducted on August 20, 2019, with an inmate at the Manhattan Correctional Center (MCC). The interview was prompted by a tip about potential shredding of sensitive documents related to inmate Jeffrey Epstein. The inmate, who worked as a garbage collector and orderly, denied any knowledge of document shredding or cover-up activities.

persons.name: Omar Daza
persons.context: Special Agent with the Office of Inspector General who was present during the interview at the Manhattan Correctional Center.

persons.name: Michael Owen Jr
persons.context: The undersigned FBI agent who conducted the interview and authored the FD-302 report.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate at MCC who is the subject of the tip regarding potential shredding of sensitive documents.

connections.description: Both were present conducting the interview at the Manhattan Correctional Center.
Agent Owen was investigating a tip related to potential document shredding concerning inmate Epstein.

events.title: Interview at MCC regarding Epstein document shredding tip
events.description: FBI agents interviewed an inmate at the Manhattan Correctional Center about a tip that sensitive documents related to Jeffrey Epstein were being shredded.

locations: Manhattan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, New York, United States
keyFacts: An FBI interview was conducted on August 20, 2019, at the Manhattan Correctional Center regarding a tip about potential shredding of sensitive documents related to Jeffrey Epstein.
The interviewee was an inmate assigned to collect garbage and act as the Warden's orderly, who denied any knowledge of document shredding or cover-up activities.
The inmate reported seeing 'a little more shredded trash than usual, maybe 2 days more,' but had no specific information linking it to Epstein.
The document is an official FBI FD-302 report, indicating an investigation into potential obstruction or cover-up activities following Epstein's death.
